data.name: 0001 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Forget about that! The truth behind this case—I've finally figured it out!

data.name: 0002 (383.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: The… truth?

data.name: 0003 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: This!

data.name: 0004 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Full of confidence, Haruhi presented the poster made by the computer club.

data.name: 0005 (383.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: And—what's this got to do with the truth?

data.name: 0006 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I respond—deliberately trying to sound forced.

data.name: 0007 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You still don't understand?

data.name: 0008 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's why you'll always be a low-ranking brigade member, Kyon.

data.name: 0009 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Although I'm not particularly interested in this inner brigade hierarchy anyways.

data.name: 0010 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Seeing as you can't make it past the "D" of "deductive reasoning," I'll explain it from zero.

data.name: 0011 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'd be honored. So, what on earth did you supposedly deduce and how?

data.name: 0012 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Look at this.

data.name: 0013 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: While saying so, Haruhi pointed to the "H2O" letters on the poster—

data.name: 0014 (383.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …Hmm?

data.name: 0015 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Look reeeally closely—these letters look like 1-10 don't they?

data.name: 0016 (383.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Well, they don't not look like that…

data.name: 0017 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: In other words, those computer society guys saw this and misunderstood the whole thing!

data.name: 0018 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It seems Haruhi's caught on to this too.

data.name: 0019 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: If this had to be a scene from a detective drama, it would be the eureka scene.

data.name: 0020 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's why there's all this fuss about class 1-10 when it doesn't even exist.

data.name: 0021 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Though there were others making a fuss of it. Look—there's even one right in front of me!

data.name: 0022 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: A flaaaawless deduction, if I do say so myself.

data.name: 0023 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: All this talk of "man-eating classrooms" and whatnot got us worried about nothing.

data.name: 0024 (383.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I see. That's certainly possible.

data.name: 0025 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Gotta remember to moderate my responses.

data.name: 0026 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You listening? It's not just possible, that's what actually happened! I'm sure of it!

data.name: 0027 (383.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: As expected of Miss Suzumiya. In fact, I also happened to hear something along these lines.

data.name: 0028 (383.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: That after staying up all night, the club members reached the limits of their fatigue…

data.name: 0029 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's it! #W30That's exactly what I'm saying!

data.name: 0030 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: In a haze of drowsiness, they saw this poster and misjudged it, making a huge fuss!

data.name: 0031 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Haruhi confidently explained things—but in reality, it's a far-fetched explanation.

data.name: 0032 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: For example—the location of the poster.

data.name: 0033 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: No matter how much it looks like 1-10, the poster was at eye level.

data.name: 0034 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: How could you possibly mistake such a low poster for the classroom plate?

data.name: 0036 (383.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: So the man-eating classroom doesn't exist after all, right?

data.name: 0037 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Exactly, Mikuru.

data.name: 0038 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: My flawless reasoning has proved it magnificently!

data.name: 0039 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: You have quite the nerve to call it flawless reasoning.

data.name: 0040 (383.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: But as far as I'm concerned—so long as Haruhi's satisfied, that's good enough.

data.name: 0041 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well? The whole thing is settled now, right?

data.name: 0042 (383.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: So the "man-eating classroom" was just the result of the club members seeing things.

data.name: 0043 (383.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Yep. But anyways, even if it only ended like that, I still had a little bit of a fun.

data.name: 0044 (383.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: About Haruhi.
